channel.title: %22Nicholas Bernstein%22
channel.description: %22Hi, I%27m Nick. I%27ve been working in IT for over 20 years. This channel is going to try and talk about how to get into IT or DevOps, how to do well once you%27re in there, and some of the questions and issues that come up when you get into the IT industry.%22
channel.itunes:summary: %22Hi, I%27m Nick. I%27ve been working in IT for over 20 years. This channel is going to try and talk about how to get into IT or DevOps, how to do well once you%27re in there, and some of the questions and issues that come up when you get into the IT industry.%22
channel.itunes:subtitle: Defending the world from Stupidity since 1979
channel.itunes:keywords: Technology, linux, devops, IT, career, windows, FreeBSD, kubernetes, software development, open source, oss
channel.item:

In this video I talk about the concept of %22Two is one and one is none%22 and the end of support for centos linux. I talk about how to consider approaching things, and the idea of making sure you have more than one operating system or vendor where you have critical resources.%0A%0A--------------------------------------------------%0AFor training info%3A https%3A%2F%2Fnicholasbernstein.com%2Ftraining%2F%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.patreon.com%2FTheNickBernsteinShow%0Atwitter%3A %40nickbernstein%0Avideos on lbry.io%3A https%3A%2F%2Fopen.lbry.io%2F%40nicktrains%3Ab%2F%0AMastadon.social%3A %40nickbernstein%40mastodon.social%0A...%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DyDsgS8Ui9Ck

upgrading-a-netapp-simulator-vlog-it-and https://cdn.lbryplayer.xyz/api/v3/streams/free/upgrading-a-netapp-simulator-vlog-it-and/17c1944e3733881b732bb37a8993b7c50c078b4d/upgrading-a-netapp-simulator.mp4 2020-06-01 12:33:49 UTC https://cdn.lbryplayer.xyz/api/v3/streams/free/upgrading-a-netapp-simulator-vlog-it-and/17c1944e3733881b732bb37a8993b7c50c078b4d/upgrading-a-netapp-simulator.mp4
In this video I demo how to do an upgrade on a netapp simulator. This is a great way to do a dry run of a netapp upgrade prior to doing it in production, or just get comfortable with it. It%27s also a good way to take an existing simulator, and maintain your current configuration, but also keep it up-to-date. %0A%0A--------------------------------------------------%0AFor training info%3A https%3A%2F%2Fnicholasbernstein.com%2Ftraining%2F%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.patreon.com%2FTheNickBernsteinShow%0Atwitter%3A %40nickbernstein%0Avideos on lbry.io%3A https%3A%2F%2Fopen.lbry.io%2F%40nicktrains%3Ab%2F%0AMastadon.social%3A %40nickbernstein%40mastodon.social%0A...%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DXHvC1NIAG04

In this video I look at calculating the number of people who will have corona virus based on using the CFR %25 and the speed of doubling to figure out how many people have it as of today. %0A%0A%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fnicholasbernstein%2Fmisc-scripts%2Fblob%2Fmaster%2Freverse_corona_count.py%0A%0A%0A%0A4%2F5%2F2020%3A %0A%0AInfected Now%3A 260000 Dead%3A 7020%0AInfected 17 days ago%3A 520000 %28 deaths in 3 days%3A 14040 %29%0AInfected 14 days ago%3A 1040000 %28 deaths in 6 days%3A 28080 %29%0AInfected 11 days ago%3A 2080000 %28 deaths in 9 days%3A 56160 %29%0AInfected 8 days ago%3A 4160000 %28 deaths in 12 days%3A 112320 %29%0AInfected 5 days ago%3A 8320000 %28 deaths in 15 days%3A 224640 %29%0A%0A%0AIf this is correct, we will have 224,640 deaths in the US on 4%2F20%2F2020 by my calculations. Hopefully social distancing will kick in and this will be much lower. %0A%0A%C2%A0--------------------------------------------------%0AFor training info%3A https%3A%2F%2Fnicholasbernstein.com%2Ftraining%2F%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.patreon.com%2FTheNickBernsteinShow%0Atwitter%3A %40nickbernstein%0Avideos on lbry.io%3A https%3A%2F%2Fopen.lbry.io%2F%40nicktrains%3Ab%2F%0AMastadon.social%3A %40nickbernstein%40mastodon.social%0A...%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D0WBnNJJwLQo
1115 In this video I look at calculating the number of people who will have corona virus based on using the CFR %25 and the speed of doubling to figure out how many people have it as of today. %0A%0A%0A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fnicholasbernstein%2Fmisc-scripts%2Fblob%2Fmaster%2Freverse_corona_count.py%0A%0A%0A%0A4%2F5%2F2020%3A %0A%0AInfected Now%3A 260000 Dead%3A 7020%0AInfected 17 days ago%3A 520000 %28 deaths in 3 days%3A 14040 %29%0AInfected 14 days ago%3A 1040000 %28 deaths in 6 days%3A 28080 %29%0AInfected 11 days ago%3A 2080000 %28 deaths in 9 days%3A 56160 %29%0AInfected 8 days ago%3A 4160000 %28 deaths in 12 days%3A 112320 %29%0AInfected 5 days ago%3A 8320000 %28 deaths in 15 days%3A 224640 %29%0A%0A%0AIf this is correct, we will have 224,640 deaths in the US on 4%2F20%2F2020 by my calculations. Hopefully social distancing will kick in and this will be much lower. %0A%0A%C2%A0--------------------------------------------------%0AFor training info%3A https%3A%2F%2Fnicholasbernstein.com%2Ftraining%2F%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.patreon.com%2FTheNickBernsteinShow%0Atwitter%3A %40nickbernstein%0Avideos on lbry.io%3A https%3A%2F%2Fopen.lbry.io%2F%40nicktrains%3Ab%2F%0AMastadon.social%3A %40nickbernstein%40mastodon.social%0A...%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D0WBnNJJwLQo
